alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 12:47PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dry wash and small stream flooding caused by heavy rain from thunderstorms is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Utah, including the following county, Carbon. * WHEN...Until 245 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause dry wash and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Price, Wellington and Wattis.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
